summary: This bill, the Strengthening Child Exploitation Enforcement Act, amends Title 18 of the U.S. Code to modify provisions related to kidnapping, sexual abuse, and illicit sexual conduct involving minors. Key changes include adding language about obtaining victims through fraud, defining a defense related to the victim's age, updating interstate commerce definitions, and creating a new offense for intentional touching of a minor's genitalia. It also includes conforming amendments and adjustments to penalties for civil rights offenses involving sexual misconduct under Section 250(b) and sentencing classifications under Section 3559.
